'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 15,916 full-time employees (as of [[September 30]] [[2007]]).<ref name=q32007results /> It is the largest American company (by [[market capitalization]]) that is not part of the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]].{{fact|date=December 2007}}
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]] and [[online advertising]]. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 15,916 full-time employees (as of [[September 30]] [[2007]]).<ref name=q32007results /> It is the largest American company (by [[market capitalization]]) that is not part of the [[Dow Jones Industrial Average]].{{fact|date=December 2007}}
â
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States dollar|US$]]1.67 billion, making it worth US$23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including [[gmail|web-based e-mail]], [[google earth|online mapping]], [[google docs|office productivity]], and [[you tube|video sharing]], among others.
+
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]] and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]], [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]], [[2004]], raising [[United States dollar|US$]]1.67 billion, making it worth US$23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial [[google search|search]] and [[AdWords|advertising]] business into other areas, including [[gmail|web-based e-mail]], [[google earth|online mapping]], [[google docs|office productivity]], and [[you tube|video sharing]], among others.
In 2006, "google" came in second on [[Merriam-Webster's Words of the Year]]<ref>[http://www.m-w.com/info/07words_prev.htm Merriam-Webster's webpage] Retrieved on [[December 30]], [[2007]]</ref>.
In 2006, "google" came in second on [[Merriam-Webster's Words of the Year]]<ref>[http://www.m-w.com/info/07words_prev.htm Merriam-Webster's webpage] Retrieved on [[December 30]], [[2007]]</ref>.
